dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo

  • public class DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo
extends java.lang.Object

    DJI Follow Me Initialization Information Class

    Contains the basic information used to initialize a follow me mission. Called by the startFollowMe method in DJIGroundStation.
    A follow me mission is a ground station mission in which the aircraft remains at an approximately fixed position relative to a target. The coordinates of the target must be updated at regular intervals, at which point the aircraft will automatically move to maintain its relative position.
    Please visit our Mobile SDK Handbook for additional explanation.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software
    See Also:
    DJIGroundStation

    • Field Detail

      • followMeMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationFollowMeMode followMeMode
        Determines which follow me mode to use. Currently only Relative_Mode is supported, in which the aircraft will maintain a fixed position relative to the target it is following.
        Other modes will be fully implemented in upcoming versions of the SDK.

      • yawMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationFollowMeYawMode yawMode
        The yaw control mode. There are two possible modes:
        Point_To_Customer - The drone will point towards the follow me target.
        Remote_Control - The drone's yaw will be controlled through the remote controller.

      • userLatitude

        public double userLatitude
        The latitude, in degrees, of the user. When the follow me mission begins, the aircraft will position itself relative to the user, before beginning to follow the target. Hence, you can think of the user as the initial position of the target.

      • userLongitude

        public double userLongitude
        The longitude , in degrees, of the user. When the follow me mission begins, the aircraft will position itself relative to the user, before beginning to follow the target. Hence, you can think of the user as the initial position of the target.

      • DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo

        public DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo()
        Constructor for DJIFollowMeInitializationInfo.
